panels.title: Resource overview (associated JOB item) currently selected host: [$show_hostname] Example: $node

panels.description: Partition usage, disk read, disk write, download bandwidth, upload bandwidth, if there are multiple network cards or multiple partitions, are the collected values of the network card or partition with the highest utilization rate.
panels.title: Server resource overview table (10 rows per page)
$job：Overall total load and overall average CPU usage
$job：Overall total memory and overall average memory usage
$job：Overall total disk and overall average disk usage

panels.description:
In this kanban, the total amount of disk, usage, Available, and Usage rate should be consistent with the values in the Size, Used, Available, and Use% columns of the df command, and the value of Use% will be rounded to one decimal place, which will be more accurate . 

Note: The Use% algorithm in df is: (size-free) * 100 / (avail + (size-free)). If the result is divisible by the value, it will be the value +1, and the result is The unit is %. 
Refer to df command source code:
panels.title: 【$show_hostname】：Available space of each partition (EXT.*/XFS)
Disk read and write capacity per second

panels.description:
Reads completed: The number of read completions per second for each disk partition

Writes completed: The number of write completions per second for each disk partition

IO now The number of input/output requests being processed per second for each disk partition
panels.title: Disk read and write rate（IOPS）

panels.description:
The time spent on I/O in every second of natural time. (Wall-clock time)

node_disk_io_time_seconds_total:
The number of seconds the disk spends on input/output operations. This value is an accumulated value. (Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os)

irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m]):
Calculate the rate per second: (last value-last previous value)/time stamp difference, that is: Disk spend in 1 second The percentage of time spent in I/O operations.
panels.title: Percentage of I/O operation time consuming per 1 second

panels.description:
Read time seconds per disk partition read operation in seconds

Write time seconds per disk partition write operation in seconds

IO time seconds per disk partition input/output operation in seconds
 
IO time weighted seconds The weighted seconds spent by each disk partition input/output operation
panels.title: Time consumed for each IO read and write (reference: less than 100ms) (beta)

panels.description:
Sockets_used - The total amount of all protocol sockets used

CurrEstab-the number of TCP connections whose current status is ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT

TCP_alloc-the number of allocated (established, applied to sk_buff) TCP sockets

TCP_tw-the number of TCP connections waiting to be closed

UDP_inuse-the number of UDP sockets in use

RetransSegs-the number of TCP retransmissions

OutSegs-the number of TCP sent packets

InSegs- Number of packets received by TCP
panels.title: Network socket connection information

yaxes.label: The total amount of all protocol sockets used

panels.title: Open file descriptor (left) / number of context switches per second (right)
